page.title: 13Waves Farm.
page.content: Waves farm covers 220 acres of land and is owned by the Wright family. They have recently lost ten acres because of the new Lincoln by-pass. Mr Wright is the uncle of the owner of Lowfields farm, which is also in our area. The Wrights keep a dairy herd which have to be milked twice a day, once in the morning and once in the evening. Seven cows can be milked at the same time. After milking the milk is pumped into a huge tanker and taken to Boultham Park Dairy. The farmer also keeps chickens, guinea fowl and two horses. One of the horses came second at the Lincolnshire Show. There are many old buildings on the farm which are having to be rebuilt or repaired. They have had a new barn built recently.
